name: dump-sourcecode
description: This Visual Studio Code extension adds a "Dump Sources" command to the explorer context menu. When you right-click on a folder, it gathers all text-based files that match user-specified file extensions, excluding files ignored by .gitignore and binary files, and concatenates their contents into a single output file. Users can configure the output file name and the list of target file extensions in the VS Code settings.

dumpSource.outputFileName.description: The name of the output file that will store the concatenated contents of all collected text-based files.

dumpSource.extensions.description: A list of file extensions to include during the dumping process (without leading dots). For example: ["txt", "ts", "js", "c"].

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
